definition: to close the market (for a holiday or overnight etc)
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
Jiexiu county level city in Jinzhong 晉中|晋中[Jin4 zhong1], Shanxi

sentences.english: Markets in Australia will remain closed for the Anzac day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲因爲澳新軍團日休市。

sentences.english: The crude oil market remained closed Friday in observance of the Good Friday holiday.
sentences.chinese: 週五因慶祝耶穌受難日，原油市場休市。

sentences.english: In Australia, markets were closed for a public holiday.
sentences.chinese: 在澳大利亞，股票市場因公休日休市。

sentences.english: The bond market was closed Monday for the Columbus Day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 由於本週一是哥倫布日假期，債券市場休市一天。

sentences.english: Many European markets will be closed on Friday, with London markets closing at midday.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲大多數國家的股市週五休市，倫敦股市中午收盤。

sentences.english: US Indices close early at 1630 (UK time).
sentences.chinese: 所有美國股票休市一天。

sentences.english: The bond markets are closed for the holiday, but many businesses and stock exchanges remain open.
sentences.chinese: 債券市場休市，但許多商家和股票交易所繼續開放。

sentences.english: Most markets in Europe were closed on Friday ahead of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲多國股市在上週五因聖誕假期休市。

sentences.english: If you bravely add the ratio before closing, you will restore most of the losses.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在休市前大膽補倉，那麼就挽回大部分的損失。

sentences.english: U.S. stock markets will remain closed Monday for the Labor Day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 本週一，美國股市因勞工日放假而休市一天。

sentences.english: China is closed this week for the Lunar New Year holiday.
sentences.chinese: 中國外匯市場因這個星期的農曆新年假期已休市。

definition: (of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day
Golden Week, two 7-day national holiday periods
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
to have a holiday or vacation
USB flash drive/see also 閃存盤|闪存盘[shan3 cun2 pan2]
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
